titles.title: To provide for the conveyance of the excess Army Reserve Center in Kewaunee, Wisconsin.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mr. Davis, Tom moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 788.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.
Senate Committee on Armed Services discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs by unanimous consent.

bill.summary: 9/10/2001--Passed House amended. Directs the Administrator of General Services to convey to the City of Kewaunee, Wisconsin, a parcel of Federal real property that is located at 401 5th Street in Kewaunee and that contains an excess Army Reserve Center. Allows such property to be used and occupied only by the city, or by another local or State government entity approved by such city, after such conveyance and prohibits the use of such property for commercial purposes.
